pageContext.description: Restored. when acquired by the Academy the discs were bent, & one was separated from the handle. The cups are encircled with 3 raised lines. The handle was found on examination to be packed with fine clay.
pageContext.publications: Johnson & Frazer, Proc. Royal Irish Academy xxi, pp. 336-337.
pageContext.collection: National Museum of Science & Art, Dublin, Plate XV, 286 138, 1898., purchased from Mr. William Augustus Ledwich.
pageContext.site: Ireland, Co Kildare, Kilrathmurry, Hill of Down, 1 1/2 miles due south of the Old Rath of Clonard, in a field
pageContext.museumCollection: National Museum of Science & Art, Dublin
pageContext.museumID: Plate XV, 286 138, 1898., purchased from Mr. William Augustus Ledwich.
